item.title: Curb at tree between 13 & 14 Well Rd, 21st August
item.description:
The curb is broken and is still high where it is hard to park. The tree roots are pushing up the curb. I am also concerned about the tree as it is leaning over the two houses and don’t want it to fall. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Well Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 14 well rd left curb as looking at the garage, 21st August
item.description:
The curb and pavement has been smashed down so it puddles water and mud. It does not properly flow to the drain close by. It has been like this since we moved in 4 years ago. Looks like a heavy truck smashed down the pavement and curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Well Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation obscuring the lane, 21st August
item.description:
I reported on June 26th that the overgrown hedgerows are making it difficult for delivery vans to access the lane. It is also obscuring the yellow lines by about half a meter. Our road sign has been propped up as it’s broken !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cross Lane, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement blocked by dangerous sited tree parts left by council contractors, 21st August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Crescent, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large public pond in church house gardens neglected dried up and full of weeds litter and lumps of concrete, 21st August
item.description:
The once lovely church house gardens park is badly neglected by the council. It has been allowed to dry up in hot weather. The council has not refilled it. Any fish in it are presumably dead all ducks and wildlife have moved on. The pond is now full of huge swathes of weeds. It is ugly and embarrassing to the community. Why has this been allowed to happen and when will the pond be restored?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner needs safety barriers, 21st August
item.description:
The corner of Margaret street and Regent street needs safety barriers at the corner and the pedestrian crossing needs to be moved further back along Margaret street to avoid a dangerous situation at the corner. Two people in recent years have been hit by buses coming around the corner and there are numerous near misses every week. The buses coming from behind the pedestrians causes a lot of issues and this could be resolved if the crossing was further along Margaret street so the buses are coming from the right as normal. I hope this makes sense but I am happy to be contacted for further discussion, if needed. Danielle Lorenzo-George - d.lorenzogeorge@gmail.com

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Margaret Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
